abstract: A control for navigating to a URL.

codeExamples.code:
Link("View Our Terms of Service",
      destination: URL(string: "https://www.example.com/TOS.html")!)

Link("Visit Our Site", destination: URL(string: "https://www.example.com")!)
    .environment(\.openURL, OpenURLAction { url in
        print("Open \(url)")
        return .handled
    })

overview:
## Overview

Create a link by providing a destination URL and a title. The title tells the user the purpose of the link, and can be a string, a title key that produces a localized string, or a view that acts as a label. The example below creates a link to `example.com` and displays the title string as a link-styled view:

When a user taps or clicks a `Link`, the default behavior depends on the contents of the URL. For example, SwiftUI opens a Universal Link in the associated app if possible, or in the user’s default web browser if not. Alternatively, you can override the default behavior by setting the [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/EnvironmentValues/openURL] environment value with a custom [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/OpenURLAction]:

As with other views, you can style links using standard view modifiers depending on the view type of the link’s label. For example, a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Text] label could be modified with a custom [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/View/font(_:)] or [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/View/foregroundColor(_:)] to customize the appearance of the link in your app’s UI.
rawMarkdown:
---
source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/SwiftUI/Link
crawled: 2025-12-02T17:08:41Z
---

# Link

**Structure**

A control for navigating to a URL.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor @preconcurrency struct Link<Label> where Label : View
```

## Overview

Create a link by providing a destination URL and a title. The title tells the user the purpose of the link, and can be a string, a title key that produces a localized string, or a view that acts as a label. The example below creates a link to `example.com` and displays the title string as a link-styled view:

```swift
Link("View Our Terms of Service",
      destination: URL(string: "https://www.example.com/TOS.html")!)
```

When a user taps or clicks a `Link`, the default behavior depends on the contents of the URL. For example, SwiftUI opens a Universal Link in the associated app if possible, or in the user’s default web browser if not. Alternatively, you can override the default behavior by setting the [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/EnvironmentValues/openURL] environment value with a custom [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/OpenURLAction]:

```swift
Link("Visit Our Site", destination: URL(string: "https://www.example.com")!)
    .environment(\.openURL, OpenURLAction { url in
        print("Open \(url)")
        return .handled
    })
```

As with other views, you can style links using standard view modifiers depending on the view type of the link’s label. For example, a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Text] label could be modified with a custom [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/View/font(_:)] or [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/View/foregroundColor(_:)] to customize the appearance of the link in your app’s UI.

## Creating a link

- **init(_:destination:)**: Creates a control, consisting of a URL and a title key, used to navigate to a URL.
- **init(destination:label:)**: Creates a control, consisting of a URL and a label, used to navigate to the given URL.

## Linking to other content

- **ShareLink**: A view that controls a sharing presentation.
- **SharePreview**: A representation of a type to display in a share preview.
- **TextFieldLink**: A control that requests text input from the user when pressed.
- **HelpLink**: A button with a standard appearance that opens app-specific help documentation.

## Conforms To

- View
